title: Anagram Week [Rename a gawk!]
content:
[url=http://brunswick.keenspace.com/]brunswick.keenspace.com/[/url]

Is just one site celebrating the week of the anagram, and I've missed nearly half of it!!!

Remember, stressed is just desserts backward.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Anagram Week [Rename a gawk!]
content:
I like palindromes more. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I didn't even know it's any anagram week.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: argh
content: It always hurts my head to try and create new anagrams.  I'm just not letter efficient.  :-(

title: Re: argh
content:
***Excerpt from the Daily Show***

Jon: What about the most famous example of a seeming miscue by this white house. Bush in the flight suit on the aircraft carrier and then in front of the banner saying MISSION ACCOMPLISHED

Steven Colbert: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon, Thats just more of your western, linear, left to right, letter in consecutive order, syllable based, banner reading. The true message was there you just had to read the letters in anagram form as it was intended CMON I LIED. SO SCAMPISH You wanted it spelled out for you, Jon, there it is. Even you would have to admit George W. Bush will go down in history as this nations scampiest Commander in Chief.[center][img]http://members.cox.net/aborlan/sig/signature2.gif[/img]
[/center]

title: Re: argh
content:
Ambigrams are even cooler.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: haha
content: Damn your elitism!  Educate the masses!  What are ambigrams?

title: Re: haha
content:
*sigh*

Ambigrams are words or phrases written so you can read them upside down or right side up. They are totally inferior to anagrams, as they require excessive effort to create.A proud member of the signature stealing society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/Kazz.gif[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: haha
content: Yeah, agree, ambigrams are a lot cooler. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Dan Brown's Demons & Angels book had some cool ambigrams of Illuminati and some elements; fire, water etc..You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: haha
content:
Here is a good starting point for information about ambigrams.
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambigram]en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ambigram[/url]

Yesterday I discovered the link (all the way at the bottom) called "Online ambigram generator" is quite nice.
[url=http://ambigram.matic.com/ambigram.htm]ambigram.matic.com/ambigram.htm[/url]
Of course this one only does upside down ones, and manually made ambigrams in theory could be nicer, since this thing always make 1 - 1 letter conversions, and some letters don't work well as something else upside down.
Some words work better than others; "Keen" looks OK.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: haha
content:
That generator is neat. As well is the Wiki entry. Seems that there's mentioned that Dan Brown's book as well. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
